titleStmt.title: Jerub-baal. Being, a three-penny answer to a twelve-penny book Written by William Assheton, D.D. and rector of Beckenham in Kent. Which he is pleased to stile a conference with an anabaptist. In which answer you have his presumptions proved to be no proofs for infant-baptism. By E.P. a preacher of the Gospel.
titleStmt.author: E. P.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed for the author, and sold by B. Harris, at the upper-end of Grace-church-street, next Corn-hill,

notesStmt.note: An answer to: Asshton, William. A conference with an Anabaptist.
Caption title on p.1 reads: Jerub-baal. Being, a three-penny answer to Dr. Ashton's Conference, &c.
Imperfect: lacking pp.16-17; pages cropped at head, affecting pagination.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

place.placeName: the upper-end of Grace-church-street, next Corn-hill
